About Us

Law Hub Development and Advocacy Centre is a non-profit civic hub of change-makers committed to the promotion of democratic governance, human rights, and civic engagement. With its operational base in Abuja, Nigeria, Law Hub focuses on in-depth research, providing critical analysis on key democratic and governance issues, crafting practical solutions, training, and empowering citizens to lead change in their community.

Our Vision

We envision a well-developed, fair, just and peaceful society for all.

Our Mission

To advance respect of human rights, rule of law and justice toward a secure, peaceful and sustainable development of the people and the society.

Who we are

Law Hub Development and Advocacy Centre is an independent, non-governmental and non-profit law, justice and development focused organization.

Law Hub implements several innovative programs aimed at stimulating active citizenship, protecting human rights, and deepening democratic governance. We invest in building networks and social movements to drive social change and transformation.
Law Hub Development and Advocacy Centre is registered with the Nigerian Corporate Affairs Commission as a non profit organisation and its accounts are independently audited and published annually.

Our Thematic Focus

Human Rights Protection

As an independent and non-partisan organization, we deploy our expertise in creating avenues for the promotion, protection and enforcement of human rights. We engage in projects to raise people’s awareness of human rights norms and our platform focuses on activities targeted at monitoring private and institutional compliance with the national and international frameworks on human rights in Nigeria. 

Through our advocacy programs and re-orientation campaigns, citizens including the poor and disadvantaged groups are given the tools to influence public policies and implement practices that directly affect social justice issues and structural causes of inequality and human rights abuses. 

We also interface with other relevant civil society organizations, ministries, departments and agencies together with the National Human Rights Commission to assist in implementing the National Action Plan (NAP) for the promotion and protection of human rights in Nigeria. We are fully involved in addressing emerging human rights issues, some of which are focused on environmental rights, digital privacy rights, data protection rights, freedom of information among others.

Rule of Law & Access to Justice

LACE works with other civil society organizations and other relevant stakeholders to develop programs with the effect of improving legal protection, legal awareness, legal aid, fixing inherent problems in the justice sector, such as lengthy pre-trial detention, police brutality and strengthening the linkages between informal and formal structures. In fostering the rule of law, it is very important that the mechanisms, processes and institutions are enhanced to support the equality of all citizens before the law, secure a non-arbitrary form of government and prevent the arbitrary use of power by elected representatives. While we actively participate in this, we also carry out activities to ensure justice service providers offer fair, effective, transparent, accountable and non-discriminatory services to promote access to justice, which is an essential component in the area of rule of law.

Justice Sector Reform

Notwithstanding the multiple challenges, there are various laudable efforts by stakeholders seeking to reform the justice sector. At LACE, we implement quality projects targeted at improving justice delivery by means of research and strategic planning, technical advisory services, policy and legislative reform. We carry out projects to strengthen the capacities of justice providers such as training the key actors to improve the effectiveness and quality of services provided by the institutions in the justice sector (courts, legal practitioners, law enforcement agencies etc.). Through some of our various projects, we passionately aim at enhancing the fairness and efficiency of justice delivered, improving accountability, transparency and integrity and facilitating coordination among the stakeholders in the justice sector.

Transparency, Accountability and Anti-Corruption

We embark on anti-corruption activities to help improve transparency, accountability and integrity within governmental and non-governmental institutions. Apart from denouncing and documenting cases of corruption and related institutional dysfunctions, we also play constructive roles by providing stakeholders with objective analyses to identify the factors that underlie corruption and its impact on access of citizens to justice, security and economic opportunities. This is to expose waste and opaque financial practices within the public administration. Along this line, we offer advice and support in drafting and implementing institutional policies aimed at eliminating corruption from institutions.

Corruption in Nigeria ranks among the highest in the world and cuts across social, political, economic and cultural strata. Thus, we regularly advocate the need for broad institutional reforms, addressing not only equipment, infrastructure and financial resources, but intangible factors, such as establishing a more service-oriented and accountable institutional culture, promoting integrity and eliminating impunity within private and public institutions and sustainable long-term management of resources.

Peace-Building & Conflict Resolution

There are challenges posed by the threat of violent and armed conflicts in Nigeria and this is a critical factor resulting in regional instability and disturbance to the peace and economic development. Our organization, LACE, is directly interested in contributing to peace dialogues and development agenda and we engage stakeholders to lend our voice to advocate for communities at national and regional levels to influence peace and security policies and debates, in an attempt to complement the efforts of the government, seeking to enhance human security and regional development. We emphasize collaborative approaches to peace-building and conflict prevention/resolution by partnering with diverse stakeholders including governments, civil society, intergovernmental bodies etc. This is to achieve strategic results by dialogue, experience sharing and learning to complement efforts from all spheres and promote sustainable peace and development in Nigeria.

Elections & Democratic Governance

In advocating for free, fair and credible election and deepening the tenets of democratic governance in Nigeria, our advocacy revolves around civic engagement, research and documentation, election monitoring, sensitization, media watch, budget tracking among others. As part of our clamour for transparency, accountability and equity in democratic governance, we engage in projects directed at monitoring the performances of elected representatives and demanding response from them on relevant national or local developmental issues; holding politicians and political institutions to account; monitoring various aspects of the electoral process to minimize nefarious activities such as unlawful use of state administrative resources for private electioneering campaigns and cases of electoral violence and other malpractices.

In this regard, we extend our advocacy efforts to monitoring the enforcement of sanctions against persons who violate the electoral law; and to broad civic and voter education about the importance of the elections, the voter registration process, and where, when and how to register and vote.

Legal Aid Services and Public Interest Litigation

As an independent and non-profit law and policy organization, we are committed to obtaining justice for the indigent, the vulnerable, the disadvantaged or marginalized at the systemic level. We address complex social problems that impact the lives of many Nigerians. We do this by conducting test cases and strategic litigation in the public interest and through the provision of legal assistance, policy advice and training of public interest lawyers and other stakeholders to effectuate positive change in society.

Public Safety and Security

Our approach to security is the human security approach, which focuses on the need for the government to respond to the different types and levels of insecurity by taking account of the real security needs of the population in all its diversity in public security policies. We monitor the policies of the government and strive to influence them, either directly or indirectly through advocacy, public statements, institutional procedures, campaigns to ensure that the human safety and security needs of the citizens are catered for in the broadest sense.

Our activities are also geared towards the promotion and protection of human rights even within the fight against insurgency, kidnapping and banditry. We achieve this by defending the vulnerable members of society. We help to reduce security threats through improving prevention by working with the population. We work to strengthen the effectiveness of security and justice sector services provided and improve the professionalism of security institutions by offering training in human rights, gender awareness, ethics etc.

We further work with stakeholders to support public decision-makers by analyzing needs, evaluating existing policies and formulating suggestions for future actions needed for the overall safety of Nigerians.

Poverty Eradication, Social and Economic Development

We recognize that demonstrable commitments to a drastic reduction of poverty and fuller enrollment in public education are crucial strategic steps in the elimination of many soci0-economic and political problems currently plaguing Nigeria. LACE regularly organizes programs to monitor government socio-economic policies and actions and hold the government to account. When necessary, we also deploy our expertise to offer alternative policies for the government, the private sector, and other institutions.

As an essential building block of development and national cohesion, we regularly come up with intelligence-driven operations and continuously engage different stakeholders in the national, regional and sub-regional communities to address social and economic issues.

Climatic Justice and Environmental Protection

There are emerging issues of environmental rights and climate change concerns. Environmental rights connote access to the unspoiled natural resources that enable survival, including land, shelter, food, water and air. Increased heat, drought, insect infestation, increased wildfires, declining water supplies, reduced agricultural yields are some of the major concerns. We take up cases or implement advocacy programs to promote the ideals of sustainable development; to preserve natural habitats and wildlife and to combat climate change.

We partner with groups, supporters, individuals and communities to engage the critical environmental issues of our time, and bring about positive change. LACE develops and leads successful strategic environmental advocacy campaigns to improve environmental quality and protect our natural heritage. LACE’s multidisciplinary staff made up of talented public interest lawyers, environmental specialists, policy advocates, and communication specialists, brings a strong and effective combination of skills to solve environmental problems and improve the quality of life in Nigerian communities.

Meet our Team

Our Geographical Coverage

We implement programs and services in rural communities, states and regions in Nigeria and across Africa, including international engagements with our international partners.

Associations & Memberships
